org.fcrepo.client

Class FcrepoClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fcrepo.client.FcrepoClient

  • public class FcrepoClient
extends Object
    Represents a client to interact with Fedora's HTTP API.
    Since:
    October 20, 2014
    Author:
    Aaron Coburn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FcrepoClient(String username, String password, String host, Boolean throwExceptionOnFailure)
      Create a FcrepoClient with a set of authentication values.

      Make a GET request
      FcrepoResponse head(URI url)
      Make a HEAD response
      FcrepoResponse patch(URI url, InputStream body)
      Make a PATCH request Please note: the body should have an application/sparql-update content-type

    • Constructor Detail

      • FcrepoClient

        public FcrepoClient(String username,
                    String password,
                    String host,
                    Boolean throwExceptionOnFailure)
        Create a FcrepoClient with a set of authentication values.
        Parameters:
        username - the username for the repository
        password - the password for the repository
        host - the authentication hostname (realm) for the repository
        throwExceptionOnFailure - whether to throw an exception on any non-2xx or 3xx HTTP responses

    • Method Detail

      • head

        public FcrepoResponse head(URI url)
                    throws FcrepoOperationFailedException
        Make a HEAD response
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the resource to check
        Returns:
        the repository response
        Throws:
        FcrepoOperationFailedException - when the underlying HTTP request results in an error

      • put

        public FcrepoResponse put(URI url,
                          InputStream body,
                          String contentType)
                   throws FcrepoOperationFailedException
        Make a PUT request
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the resource to PUT
        body - the contents of the resource to send
        contentType - the MIMEType of the resource
        Returns:
        the repository response
        Throws:
        FcrepoOperationFailedException - when the underlying HTTP request results in an error

      • patch

        public FcrepoResponse patch(URI url,
                            InputStream body)
                     throws FcrepoOperationFailedException
        Make a PATCH request Please note: the body should have an application/sparql-update content-type
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the resource to PATCH
        body - the body to be sent to the repository
        Returns:
        the repository response
        Throws:
        FcrepoOperationFailedException - when the underlying HTTP request results in an error

      • post

        public FcrepoResponse post(URI url,
                           InputStream body,
                           String contentType)
                    throws FcrepoOperationFailedException
        Make a POST request
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the resource to which to POST
        body - the content to be sent to the server
        contentType - the Content-Type of the body
        Returns:
        the repository response
        Throws:
        FcrepoOperationFailedException - when the underlying HTTP request results in an error

      • delete

        public FcrepoResponse delete(URI url)
                      throws FcrepoOperationFailedException
        Make a DELETE request
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the resource to delete
        Returns:
        the repository response
        Throws:
        FcrepoOperationFailedException - when the underlying HTTP request results in an error

      • get

        public FcrepoResponse get(URI url,
                          String accept,
                          String prefer)
                   throws FcrepoOperationFailedException
        Make a GET request
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the resource to fetch
        accept - the requested MIMEType of the resource to be retrieved
        prefer - the value for a prefer header sent in the request
        Returns:
        the repository response
        Throws:
        FcrepoOperationFailedException - when the underlying HTTP request results in an error
